utterances.sentences: Look, if you can't convince the public of your argument and, therefore, you can't win the elections, you don't have Hillary Clinton in the White House, you don't have the ability to make all the regulations she would have if she'd been there, you can't convince voters of your climate change event agenda for legislation etcetera, the only way you can do it--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: STRASSEL
utterances.sentences: --is to make it up or to get the courts to sign off on it. And so, that has been the strategy of Democrats for a long time. Think about when was the last major piece of legislation other than Obamacare that they managed to get through, which has been an enormous, obviously, very unpopular.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: That's such a good point. And they suffered for it, electorically - electorally. Kim Strassel, thank you. Thank you again for everything you've done on this story.

utterances.speaker: STRASSEL
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Just read all of it really carefully. Thanks. Well the FBI investigation did not uncover crimes by Brett Kavanaugh, did not corroborate Christine Ford's story, it might have uncovered witness tampering by allies of Christine Ford, pretty amazing story. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } And then an announcement about what we think is a pretty good new book. It's called Ship of Fools. We've got something to tell you about it, that's just ahead.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Well barring a final twist, which could happen, but as of right now, it looks like the effort to destroy Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination by destroying his reputation has failed. One possible reason for that failure could be that Stormy Daniels' lawyer overreached and made absurd gang-rape allegations that reminded people that actually the presumption of innocence matters. That's why we've had it for over a 1,000 years in the West. But that wasn't the only thing we learned or that mattered. According to The Wall Street Journal, Christine Ford's friend, Leland Keyser, from Chevy Chase, Maryland, told the FBI she faced massive pressure from Ford's friends to change her sworn statement and say that she remembered the party where Kavanaugh supposedly assaulted her. Dan Bongino is a former Secret Service Agent, an NYPD officer, author of the book Spygate: The Attempted Sabotage of Donald J. Trump, he joins us tonight. So Dan, you're a former sworn officer, a law enforcement officer, is attempting to get someone to change sworn testimony legal?

utterances.speaker: DAN BONGINO, NRATV CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Legal? Absolutely - absolutely not. Not - not only you - would you be fired from your job, I was a cop and a federal agent, so I've seen it at the local and federal level, there's potential there depending on the degree of it that you'd be locked up yourself issuing your own statement. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } No, this is entirely unethical. And Tucker, I believe the House Republic - excuse me, the Senate Republicans have finally decided that it's time to fight back against this. I don't know if you saw Chuck Grassley's letter. But in there he says, in light of recently uncovered information that he asked them to turn over a bunch of new documents, I think that they see that there may be some potential legal malfeasance going on here, and good for them for fighting back.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: And this is apparently, according to the account we read today, a former Secret Service - I mean rather a former FBI employee who tried to get Leland Keyser to change her sworn statement, is that correct?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. It was McLean with the friend, the lifelong friend whose name was given up by the - the ex-boyfriend of Dr. Ford as well. What's particularly disturbing about this whole story, Tucker, is the Republicans - the Senate Republicans treated Dr. Ford there with a - with the degree of very serious dignity. They put her up there. They let her tell her story. They treated her with respect. They brought in a professional prosecutor to question her. There were no politically biased questions. They just tried to get the facts out, the facts adding --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: --as we know, there were enormous numbers of holes, and this case it - they're starting to look really bad for the Democrats who put this together and Avenatti's not helping. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: No. And I mean as you well know, since you follow this so carefully, it's an asymmetrical contest between one side that's very literal and the other side will do anything.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's a - it's a euphemism game with them. But Tucker, can I just say, you know, without getting too ridiculous or hyperbolic, we can define ourselves by negation, right? I mean the whole resistance movement on the Left is doing that. They're defining themselves by what they're not. They don't like Donald Trump. I believe the entrance of Avenatti into this case was the turning point. This guy's a creep. He's a disgrace to the legal profession and everybody knows it. And people watch that on TV, independents, women voters, moderates, and they looked at that and they said, "You know what? We're not that guy. That's not--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Oh, I - I - I totally agree with that.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: --us. Those are ridiculous charges."

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: You know, whatever he's for-- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: That happens --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --I'm not for it. And I - I think that's right. I think it's a fair conclusion. Dan Bongino, it's always great to have you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Tucker.  WSJ: Friend of Ford felt pressured to revisit statement

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Joining us now is Dan Summers. He's - Jon Summers. He's a Former Communications Director for Senator Harry Reid. Jon, thanks a lot for coming on. So, what's your reaction to this story that an ally of Christine Ford's, according to Leland Keyser apparently, tried to get Keyser to change her sworn testimony, which as you discern, and I think we both agree is a crime, it's certainly wrong, what do you make of that?

utterances.speaker: JON SUMMERS, FORMER SEN. REID COMMUNICATIONS DIRECTOR
utterances.sentences: Well I don't know that I agree it's a crime and it is something that we've seen on both sides. And we know that Kavanaugh, you know, was also talking to his friend. She was talking to hers. So, you know, I think what it all boils down to go --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Wait, wait, do we, wait, no wait, hold on, before you do, I - I mean I think I've followed it pretty closely, is there an allegation that someone was pushed to change sworn testimony? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: There was talk about Kavanaugh talking with his friends who might be approached by the FBI. And the way that you're characterizing her as changing her testimony--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: But - but they hadn't made sworn--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --was not actually the way--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --that story was written in the--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --well she's saying that--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --Wall Street Journal. It was-- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --she was pushed to change her - her account--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: She was saying that she was--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --her sworn testimony.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --asked to revisit her account. I'm not going to defend that--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Oh, revisit.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --that's not for me to defend because I don't actually think--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Revisit?

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --that it was the right thing to do but both sides are guilty.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: What I actually do think the right thing to do would have been--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Think both sides are guilty--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --would be for everyone--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --yes.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --to take a breath, and take a step back and actually take the time--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: I agree that.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --to go in and investigate all this stuff both on behalf of the accused and the accuser so there could be some clarity brought to this, and the right people could be held--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: So let me ask you--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --accountable. And unfortunately --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --so when you saw --

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --that was missing in this process because there was a rush to get it done. It would have been nice if we'd been able to take a breath--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --yes, it's only seven FBI investigations--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --and did the investigations.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --into Kavanaugh. I do think we would need an eighth FBI investigation to, you know--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: Well let's remember that that--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --clear his name from charges that don't make any sense.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --Hastert also had clearance and no one knew he was a child molester for a long, long time so--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: OK. But we're not - we're not going to, wait, hold on--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --let's be clear that there are things that are missed.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --what - no, no, let me be clear, what we're not going to do is try to impugn Brett Kavanaugh's reputation by comparing him to a child molester because that would be wrong and guilt by association. He's got nothing to do with Denny Hastert, as you know. But let me ask you this, when you see your senator from the Democratic Party, Joe Manchin of West Virginia, announce his vote, which is consistent with what his voters want, according to public opinion polling, and a bunch of angry Left-wing children surround him and scream at him, does that bother you at all? I mean is that the kind of democratic process that you want for your country?

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: I mean people do have the opportunity to approach their elected officials and - and make their voices heard.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: And scream at them?

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: Now, Joe Manchin --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: No but - no but let's--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --it's not appropriately discreet method --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --speak look, I defend--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --and I agree --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --the First Amendment in a way that the Left does not, so I will take a back seat to no one on the First Amendment question. They have a right to do it, I guess. But is that what you want? Do you want people screaming at lawmakers until they change their view? And if that's OK, why is it not OK to slash their tires?

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Or throw them with cocktails with it for - no, I'm - I'm serious. If you're going to bully people, what's the kind of limit to that?

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: Well and you've got bullying on both sides. We know that both sides--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: No, you don't--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --have been doing this. Oh, you absolutely do--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Really? Where? Where?

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --Tucker. But - but I'm not surprised at all --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: So, show me the mob - show me the mob of screaming Right-wing children that's changed a vote?

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --I think it's - I - I actually think--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: I haven't seen that.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --it's a waste of time to - to go after and scream at Manchin and do all of that. He's voted the way I expected he would vote the entire time, which I think is viewed by him as the politically safe way to go. I have to say I'm actually--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think that's right.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --really impressed, I'm really impressed with senators Collins, Murkowski, and Heitkamp because it was very clear that all three of them put some serious thought into this. I still expected Collins to vote the way that we expect her to vote tomorrow on the - on the confirmation, but it was clear that she actually put some thought into it. I don't agree with everything she said--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes. No, but it was--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --but it was clear she put some thought into it--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --she made a reasonable case and now she's being dismissed as some Right-wing crazy--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --and note and - and the same, you know, the same sort of--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --which is hilarious. Yes.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --thoughtfulness can be applied to--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --Murkowski and Heitkamp as well. Republican or Democrat--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Heidi Heitkamp but Murkowski made a nonsensical--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: --they're two of the most conservative states in the country.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --yes. Well good luck to them--

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: What's that?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --good luck to them. Jon, thank you very much for coming on tonight.

utterances.speaker: SUMMERS
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: One Republican senator says Julie Swetnick, being represented by creepy porn lawyer, should face charges for making false allegations against Judge Kavanaugh. That Senator joins us next. Plus, we've got a special message for you about a book you ought to read. That's coming up too.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Please move to South Carolina.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We are voting you out of office.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I hope you'd come. Oh, you'd be welcome in South Carolina.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You don't believe your daughters, believe your mother, believe your sisters.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: How you lied under oath ?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You have changed.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Maybe he lied under oath.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I don't - I mean you've been --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: He lied under oath. He didn't drink. He didn't - he didn't --

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Angry, rich ladies. It's been a rough week for senators on Capitol Hill. Lindsey Graham though seems to be looking at the bright side of the harassment he's facing. When they haven't been being shouted at by angry people, senators have had to sort through a blizzard of dubious accusations against Brett Kavanaugh. First among them is one made by Julie Swetnick, who's being represented by a creepy porn lawyer who's running for president. She swore in a statement that she knew Kavanaugh was a gang-rapist. Well, no evidence has been produced and it seems pretty clear it's a fantasy at this point. Senator Bill Cassidy of Louisiana says that if it turns out that Swetnick lied, she ought to face criminal investigation, at the least. He joins us tonight. Senator, thank you very much for coming on.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BILL CASSIDY, R-LA.
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: So what would it mean legally if Julie Swetnick lied in that statement that she gave?

utterances.speaker: CASSIDY
utterances.sentences: She - she - when you give that statement under oath, under penalty of felony, it is a felony. Now, you may not go and do hard time but you certainly should be severely fined and it should be recognized as such. We continue to tell the American people these statements are made under penalty of felony and, therefore, you can have faith in them. When someone makes a mockery of it, then they should be penalized and punished because what really is at stake is the faith of the American people in the process.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: I've never seen; I can't think of a false accuser ever being punished. I mean the woman who accused the Duke rape - Lacrosse players of rape only went back to prison when she murdered someone, the same with the UVA fraternity false accusations, have you ever seen anybody punished for making a false rape accusation?

utterances.speaker: CASSIDY
utterances.sentences: Absolutely, for making a false statement to the FBI. People are going to prison--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CASSIDY
utterances.sentences: --for that. And so, this was to be the equivalent of an FBI interview. And that's why I go there. We've had high-ranking administration officials who've lost their jobs because of it. In my state--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CASSIDY
utterances.sentences: --a fellow went to prison over something where the FBI agent remembered a statement, did not have a recording, just remembered it. That's the kind of scrutiny and threshold that typically is required. I think it should have the same scrutiny and threshold now.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Well I think it should too. Are you all going to follow up on this?

utterances.speaker: CASSIDY
utterances.sentences: So this is going to be up to the Judiciary Committee. Grassley has suggested that he might make a referral. It'll be up to Chairman Grassley. But the way I look at it, we continue to say to the American people the statements that Brett Kavanaugh had not participated in anything that he was alleged to have done, were made under penalty of felony, we should show--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: CASSIDY
utterances.sentences: --why that is important. And by the way, everybody who said everybody else under penalty of felony said Kavanaugh had not done it and that includes the people who subsequently spoke to the FBI, so let's just show--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: CASSIDY
utterances.sentences: --the American People that means something.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: I think - I think that's a really fair point. Senator, thank you very much for talking to us tonight.

utterances.speaker: CASSIDY
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: One quick message for you. Bob Woodward has been a famous guy in journalism for close to 50 years. As a young man, he taunted - tormented the Washington establishment most famously during Watergate, then he joined the other team. Woodward is now permanent Washington's court historian. He tells their stories and promotes their causes. In return, his books go to the top of the bestseller list. That's where he is again now. It's frustrating to watch. But tonight, there is something you can do about it. There's a brand new book out this week that could dislodge Woodward's book from the top of the bestseller lists. Instead of celebrating the Washington ruling class, this book points out the many ways they have chosen to ignore, mock and, sometimes, betray the country they rule over. The book is called Ship of Fools. We've told you about it before. So, if you want to knock Bob Woodward from his perch, there's something you can do. You can order Ship of Fools in the next 24 hours. It might be a nice statement. Up next, Brett Kavanaugh seems to have overcome the many sexual assault allegations levied against him but not proved. But has DNC Vice Chairman Keith Ellison done the same? His ex-girlfriend has hired a new lawyer and we talked to him. That's coming up.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Democrats in Minnesota have wrapped up their investigation of the abuse allegations being made against Congressman Keith Ellison. The conclusion, nothing to see here. The accuser, Ellison's former girlfriend, Karen Monahan isn't giving up though. She has just hired a new attorney. His name is Andrew Parker and he joins us tonight. Mr. Parker, thank you for coming on. The--

utterances.speaker: ANDREW PARKER, KAREN MONAHAN'S LAWYER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --report from the Democratic Party of Minnesota basically says "We can't prove this. We have no evidence that it happened. Let's move on." Are you satisfied by that?

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: Well first, Karen man - Monahan did not raise the allegations in order for to - to vindicate herself or prove anything to anyone. What she is - was doing by raising these allegations was number one, really trying to heal herself by coming forward and heal what was the most traumatic time in her life, and continued to be long after she left Keith Ellison. And this has been a cathartic but extremely harrowing experience since she left the relationship. The second reason is because she wanted to give a voice to other women, other women who still have not come forward--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: --but are involved in very difficult relationships--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Abusive relationships. So but let me ask you about that--

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: --and as it relates--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --so, you have a woman representing the State of Minnesota in the U.S. Senate, Amy Klobuchar who's been on television these last few weeks attacking Brett Kavanaugh and reminding us that we need to believe the allegations that women make. Has she spoken to Keith Ellison? Has she spoken publicly about this? Has she spoken to Karen Monahan about this?

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know what Senator Klobuchar's view is regarding the Ellison situation. I can say that--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Well has she said anything in public that you're aware of?

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: Not that - not that I'm aware of.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: OK. Are there police reports to substantiate this allegation?

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: There are not police reports that substantiate it, and the investigator who was hired by the Minnesota Democratic Party after the Democratic National Committee kicked this issue investigating its Deputy Chair down to the State Party, for some reason, the State Party decided to hire an excellent law firm, but the one law firm that represents the Democrats in the State of Minnesota, you know, to investigate one of its own.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Huh?

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: So what happened was an investigative report is issued with substantial corroborative evidence.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: No doubt about it that I can go through--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: No, we're aware of it.

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: --but the conclusion of unsubstantiated.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right. So, I mean there are texts from Karen Monahan to her friends about this incident. There are notes from her therapist about this incident. And yet, the party's not taking it seriously, why do you think that is? And I don't want to ask you to speculate but the irony is kind of unavoidable here. In the middle of a moment when Democrats are telling us that these allegations must be taken seriously, it doesn't appear that they're taking these allegations seriously, why?

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: Well, in addition to the corroborative evidence, there were four witnesses identified. All of them corroborated the story that Karen Monahan told them that they completely believed her and she told it to them shortly after the incident occurred and well over a year and a half before she came out publicly.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: So, Democrats have said the - the - the - the law firm, the Democratic firm in Minneapolis that did this so-called investigation said "Well look, Karen Monahan doesn't want to release the videotape she says she has of this altercation, therefore we can't take her seriously." Is that true? And if so, why isn't she releasing the videotape?

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: The primary reason why she is not releasing the videotape is number one, it - it re-victimizes her. She refuses to be bullied into being re- victimized. It is a very hurtful video for her to show to anyone. And she did not--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Have you seen it?

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: --I have not. And she did not inject the video into this process at all. In fact, she didn't want to go public that she even had a video--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: --it was her son that unwittingly had done that. Second reason, though, is very important. And that is, she came forward in order to give voice, in order to shine light that women can step out into in order to tell their story.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: And if they believe you have to have a video in order to be believed and even with all the corroborative evidence, Tucker, that Karen Monahan has, she isn't believed unless she shows a video.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've noticed.

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: That is a message that she does not want to give.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Well it's quite the standard. And again, the irony here is almost overwhelming, I would say. Thank you, Mr. Parker for - for relaying all of that to us. We appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: PARKER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Well after decades of defending him, the Left is rethinking its views on Bill Clinton from decades ago. It's kind of an amazing story. Plus, we'll have celebrities reacting to Brett Kavanaugh's imminent confirmation. And, of course, you're going to want to see that because you can't make a decision without a washed-up sitcom actor telling you what to think. Can you? We'll be right back.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Well some in the celebrity community are taking Brett Kavanaugh's likely confirmation personally and hard. Over in ABC on "The View," Joy Behar, who, honestly, clearly has something wrong with her, declared that a vote for Kavanaugh is a vote for legalizing sexual assault. Watch this. JOY BEHAR, "THE VIEW": The message to boys is, if you become a powerful man, you are allowed to grope a woman.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes, she needs to take some time off and just get some fresh air. Meanwhile, alleged comedian Amy Schumer was more hands-on. She got arrested, sort of, protesting on Capitol Hill here today. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you want to get arrested?

utterances.speaker: AMY SCHUMER, STAND-UP COMEDIAN, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You want to get arrested? Exit. Now.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Man. She cares more than we do. Allie Beth Stuckey hosts the Relatable podcast on CRTV and joins us tonight. Allie, thanks a lot for coming on. So what are we to--

utterances.speaker: ALLIE BETH STUCKEY, RELATABLE PODCAST
utterances.sentences: Yes, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --make of this celebrity community that's really speaking as one voice. That's why it's a community--

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --and they're telling us that confirming Brett Kavanaugh further evidence that the rest of us are disgusting. Do you buy it?

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: Right. Right, well this is a straw man, obviously. No one is making this argument. Although, Senator Collins pointed out today that a lot of people are making this argument on the Left that if you want to confirm Kavanaugh, then you were approving sexual assault. That is obviously not true. I don't know anyone who thinks that way. Confirming Kavanaugh has to do with his competence, his qualifications, and even bigger than that, truth and - and justice. This is not about condoning sexual assault but it is about the condemnation of these evil tactics that we've seen on the Left of ruining someone's life based on unsubstantiated allegations and that is something people on the Right and the Left should be scared of.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: So, if everybody in the entertainment business, the business that whose purpose it is to entertain the rest of us is on one side and expressing open contempt for the country they're supposed to be entertaining, why are the rest of us playing along and consuming the crap that they produce?

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: Right. I know. Well it's kind of this conundrum. On the one hand, we looked at them for entertainment but then now they've deemed themselves the - the moral and political arbiters of this world. And hey, if they want to have a conversation about sexual ethics and morality, I am ready to have that conversation as a conservative Christian. What I'm not OK with is the hypocrisy that we see of not condemning their own side--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: --and only doing it when it's in a, you know, partisan and convenient.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes. They're atheist but they're still religious nuts in case you haven't noticed. Very quick, after more than --

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --20 years, there's a video showing the former President Bill Clinton meeting with Monica in the Oval Office. It's finally been released to the public. It comes as the public seems to finally be turning on Clinton even on the Left for his behavior decades ago. Last night, an actress called Alyssa Milano, I think her name is, said the President should have been investigated--

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --for his behavior. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS CUOMO, CNN
utterances.sentences: Look at Bill Clinton. He was accused of a lot of ugly things. Some of it he had to admit. And yet, people were fine with him and saying you have to judge him by more than him at his worst. Should Kavanaugh get the same benefit of the doubt?

utterances.speaker: ALYSSA MILANO, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: No. And I don't think Bill Clinton should have gotten that benefit of the doubt in hindsight. We probably should have investigated the allegations against him as well.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: So what do you - what do you make? Is she arguing that Clinton got too much due process or what is she saying exactly?

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: I don't think she knows. I think that she was kind of caught in her hypocrisy there. But maybe this is a win for--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: --self-awareness. I also think it's maybe saving face. A tweet resurfaced from 2012 where she said she loves Bill Clinton, so maybe she's had a change of heart and maybe other self-aware celebrities will follow suit. We can only hope.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: A win for self-awareness, that's my favorite line of the week. I'm putting it on my refrigerator.

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, good.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: And by the way if that's true, it's good news.

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, I feel good about that.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: We need more of that. Allie, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Do you remember the Russia probe? Russia, used to be a news story. Now, it may be a news story again. A top lawyer for Hillary Clinton's campaign apparently supplied documents to the FBI for the investigation into the Trump campaign. That's pretty amazing. The Russia investigation, of course, is a grand distraction that permanent Washington uses to avoid confronting the real reasons the country rebelled against them and elected Trump. That's the subject of a great new book called Ship of Fools. Consider grabbing a copy online. Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: TEXT
utterances.sentences: TUCKER'S BOOK IS OUT NOW.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Well like gravity, the Russia investigation is eternal, a fact of physics in Washington, it's a constant force in our lives that apparently will never go away. We're powerless in its face. Just because we're all distracted by Brett Kavanaugh for a month doesn't mean that Russia is no longer being investigated, we should be very afraid about how they hacked our election. Well Fox News can now report that in 2016, Michael Sussman, he was a top lawyer with the DNC and the Hillary Clinton campaign, contacted the FBI and provided Russia related documents. Those documents were turned over just as the bureau was preparing a surveillance warrant against Carter Page. At the moment, the Obama Administration was spying on his political opponents. Tom Fitton is the president of Judicial Watch and he joins us tonight. Tom, thank you for coming on. Tell us what this means--

utterances.speaker: TOM FITTON, JUDICIAL WATCH
utterances.sentences: You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: --exactly.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: Well it brings the collusion story - look - the Perkins Coie, the law - law firm--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: --was a cut-out originally for the Clinton operation to pay Fusion GPS.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: And I guess after a while they said why - why pretend anymore? Let's just deal directly with our friends in the Obama FBI to target--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: --President Trump. And, you know, it's just another piece of evidence of the collusion between the Obama camp and the Clinton camp, and there's no evidence coming out of collusion between Trump and Russia. All the evidence is that you were using - that we were using the FBI to launder political garbage as an excuse to target President Trump.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: And the question I have always is what is Robert Mueller doing with this material? Is he using this Clinton campaign material to target Trump as well?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Well I guess we're going to find out. I - I got to kind of wonder about the FBI. And again, there's a lot we don't know. And I don't, you know, I don't want to attack people unfairly. On the other hand, if you're the FBI and one campaign comes to you with opposition research about the other campaign, don't you pause and say, "Wait a second. I don't want to get caught up in some kind of campaign tactic in the middle of a presidential year." Doesn't that make you nervous if you're the FBI?

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: It ought to. Look, there's no good reason for the General Counsel of the FBI to be meeting with a top lawyer for the Democratic National Committee and the Hillary Clinton campaign. The meeting itself was unusual. And the fact that there was allegedly transfer of information about Donald Trump and Russia and we know the information that generally had been being pushed by this - the - the Clinton operation was--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: --really stuff made up by Russia intelligence to mess with Donald Trump. So, it was fake information used for partisan purposes, and the FBI was happy to use it as a pretext, as I point out, to target Trump. And you got to wonder, Tucker, you know, this debate about whether they classify information and the FBI and DOJ being very nervous about that for national security reasons, well I suspect this is why they're nervous because this is the type of information that would come out as a result of a transparency initiative by President Trump.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Just to clarify, nervous about damage to their own reputation, you're saying?

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: Well and - and worse. Look, if you're misusing your office for political purposes as government officials in the real world or the non- Washington D.C. world, you'd be subject to--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: --prosecution.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: No. That's a - that's a - and thank you for reminding us of that. These are crimes, some of these things that are being alleged. Tom Fitton, as always, thanks a lot.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.sentences: You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Amazingly, our week is over. 15 nights in a row we brought you the latest on the Kavanaugh saga and it may come to an end tomorrow afternoon. Obviously, Fox will be on that. We'll be back Monday to, as we always do, fight lying, pomposity, smugness, and groupthink. By the way, if you want to help us knock Bob Woodward off the top of the bestseller list, be sure to check out a book called "Ship of Fools." It's on shipoffoolsbook.com, and grab a copy. That would be a statement, wouldn't it, maybe a statement worth sending.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Thanks again for a great week. We're looking forward to seeing you on Monday. Guess who's next? You know the answer. Sean Hannity. We're going to turn it over to him. Have a great weekend. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
